website_summaries.verdict: Well loved liners from a popular brand. The tissue box style packaging is ideal for single-handed dispensing or on-the-go use.
pros: Soft and flexible enough to stretch over any diaper size
Bamboo viscose material is eco-friendly and flushable
Large size can be cut in half for small diapers
The box makes storing and dispensing the liners that much easier
cons: Can bunch up and start to disintegrate when very wet

customer_reviews.title: Why did you change the size?!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for 2 years and they have been great! Now when I reordered them they are about 1.5-2 inches shorter! Why? I guess I'm going to have start looking for something else. These just aren't big enough now!
customer_reviews.author: VH

customer_reviews.title: Makes life so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these for cloth diapers! I literally just lay it in the diaper, and if my daughter poops, it catches most or all of it. Makes clean up waaaaaaay easier. I'm just sad that I waited until she was almost a year old to start using them!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Way Better Than Diaper Sprayers
customer_reviews.text: This is my third year and second kiddo to use Bumkins Flushable Diaper Liners. I buy a box of liners about once a month. I line all of my Bumgenius Freetimes with these liners, and they neatly capture #2's that I then put straight into the trash. Liners are way easier and neater than dealing with diaper sprayers. Diaper sprayers leave you with a wet drippy mess. I learned this the hard way before discovering diaper liners. We live in an old house so I don't flush these (since I'm not sure that our pipes could handle them), but they still work very well for us.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kotulka

customer_reviews.title: Not Great, Not Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these all of one day, but both my sons have pooped at least twice in their cloth diapers. One son’s poop was somewhat solid and it still went through the liner and onto the diaper. My other son’s poop was much more liquidy and that definitely went through. It does make it easier to clean up in general, but not by much. I’m going to try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: ARK

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Flushable Liners
customer_reviews.text: These are great. The size covers the inside of the diaper well and it's strong enough to hold poo. I also flush these when soiled and have had no problems with it messing with the pipes in our old house. It's no worse than TP on them. I've gotten them a few times when we've needed a liner between the cloth diapers and a cream we used that was not cloth safe. Also gotten to make our diapering routine easier and not have to spray soiled diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: **UPDATE**
customer_reviews.text: First glance. These are really soft!! Way softer then anything I've tried so far. They fit perfectly over my grovia hybrids. I like that I don't have to tare them but at first they are a little tricky to get out of the box but I'm sure that will ease up as I use some. So far 4 stars. Ill update as I test them out more **I really wanted to like these but they crumbled up and didnt hold anything in :( I will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been cloth diapering for a few months now, and I started with using these to help catch poop. They work great for me, are quite thin so it doesn't affect absorbency, and makes clean up way easier. My son is now 8 months old so he poops a handful of times a day. It's rare for the liner to not catch it all. I just use one sheet per diaper. I don't flush them, I just toss them in the garbage. But it would make it a lot easier to toss the poop into the toilet if you wanted to go that route.
customer_reviews.author: brad2deb

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in price and quality
customer_reviews.text: These barely help keep the poop off of the diapers and they also disintegrate when the baby pees. The fibers clump up and have to be cleaned off my baby. I am not a fan of these but at least they were only like 9$.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi A

customer_reviews.title: The solution
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have had these when cloth diapering my oldest! Once the EBF poop stops you've got to figure out how to rid the poop before tossing in the wash. Diaper spraying, dunk and swish, and the poop spatula weren't my thing. Literally dealing with the poop made cloth diapering so miserable for me. Using the liners has simplified the poop situation, just toss in the trash. I also am not riddled with guilt since the liner is biodegradable. Win win
customer_reviews.author: Car

customer_reviews.title: Do not disintegrate
customer_reviews.text: Great product, fits all diapers. As other reviewers have said, this DOES NOT dissolve or come apart in water and can be a pipe clogging hazzard. This will be apparent if you wash them they will survive a pre-wash followed by a high agitation wash intact and tangled with your cloth diapers. That said, we did use these for a year and a half with no issues with our pipes, but we only flushed ones with solid waste.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to read such positive reviews about this product. However, this was not our experience. Too thin. Tangled easy when toddler moves. Doesn’t protect the diaper from number two’s. Leaves a mark after each one. Dissolved almost when the toddler pees. Maybe I got a bad batch.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: Its a great idea and hoped it would work for us like ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these just to try for my cloth diapers. I have an active 18m old and these didn't really stand up. They just got all bunched up and were basically pointless. If he were a lot younger maybe it wouldn't have? Its a great idea and hoped it would work for us like it has others but unfortunately it didn't. We eventually just used those Viva paper towels, the ones that are "like cloth" and they worked great until he reacted to it. Sensitve skin our son has. They didn't bunch and covered a little more area though.
customer_reviews.author: Dacia G.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for cleaning Cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I was afraid we would have to quit cloth diapering when my baby started solids, but these liners are amazing! Just shake into toilet and discard! (I never flush anything other than toilet paper no matter what the product says.) The liner allowed the liquid to easily pass through to the diaper but kept the mostly solid (#2) away from the diaper fabric. Will buy again! (No need to buy sprayers and scrapers, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Kar

customer_reviews.title: Use for BumGenius
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my BumGenius diapers. My babysitter was VERY opposed to cloth diapering but is is because of these liners that she got on board and is STILL on board. They do a great job limiting the mess of a poopy cloth diaper. I use them by unfolding the liner and wrapping it around the BumGenius flap so it doesn't move around.
customer_reviews.author: K. S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to toss the liner and solid waste (even no ...
customer_reviews.text: Fold in half and they fit well in a cloth diaper. Easy to toss the liner and solid waste (even no so solid) into the toilet. It isn't going to catch every single bit, there will still be some that gets on the diaper. Over the last 4 years of use (two kids) I haven't had a toilet clog with these. Many of them have gone through the washing machine but they don't make a big mess, just get stretched out into a rope. I definitely recommend it as a way to get rid of solid waste from a cloth diaper without using a hose attached to the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. I do like that they are flushable, but they don't make cloth diaper much easier. They stretch and get squished together and start to break down because of the pee. And when my toddler poops, it gets on the sides of the diaper because the liner becomes wedged towards the center of the diaper. And I have to dunk and swish or use toilet paper because I don't have a sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Fluff

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and plenty big. I can’t believe we CDed so long without these. We don’t flush them, though, bc of other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Carter

customer_reviews.title: Happy with these liners
customer_reviews.text: I think these are actually softer than the microfiber diapers we use, or maybe the diapers have detergent residue, but whatever the reason, there is actually less redness on her bum when we use the liners. We previously used another brand that was too rough and switched to these. We have been using them for months. I really like these for their softness. I use them diagonally, however--lengthwise in the diaper from corner to corner, folding the short corners along the sides. I only wish they were longer than 11 inches so I did not have to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Never again!
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. I bought these to protect my son from diaper rash and I feel these have promoted his rash instead! They are soft and tissue like but they work like that too and stick to his skin. When I try to remove them I need to peel them away from his buttocks. Then they either shred or layers would separate with a thin layer stuck to my sons skin so it couldn't breathe and that is when the rash would begin. Also trying to get the thin layer of 'tissue' off his skin was next to impossible and the excessive wiping irritated his skin further. I will never buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: The sizing on these liners is not in line with any cloth diaper I have ever seen. The texture is also odd, and the fibers get stuck to my child's skin. I prefer the liners on a roll and won't be ordering these again.
customer_reviews.author: Chouser

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Alvababy
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this because I felt like it would add to the bulk and may get bunched up inside the diaper. But since it wasn’t an expensive investment, I decided to give it a try. Soooo worth it. It did get bunched up inside my baby’s diaper the first time I put it on because i unfolded it. It worked better the second time when I kept the fold it was packaged in. I use the Alvababy diaper system. No more messy diaper rinses over the toilet!
customer_reviews.author: dane uy kimpang

customer_reviews.title: A great Product for Potty Training.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased theses liners for my sons cloth diaper insert he has very sensitive skin. It help catch the solids so there is a easier dumping and cleaniing of his cloth diaper underneath. I have a very active 2 yr old that were trying to potty train so that he can transition to undies. They work perfectly and love how soft they are and don't break out his skin.
customer_reviews.author: QUEEN ZELDA

customer_reviews.title: liners work good, feel soft
customer_reviews.text: i have tried other brands and this seems to be the most soft and workable. the price is decent compared with other brands, not the cheapest, but reasonible. i tried cutting them in half as some reviewers suggested, but it didnt work for me. they bunched up and became useless in the diaper. i suggest not to cut them to save money. instead, learn to gauge when your baby will likely poop and line the diaper then. save money by using only when ur baby is most likely to poop. the liners defintely help with cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: christina canchola

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down the BEST liner. Just buy these.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried multiple different brands of liners. I keep coming back to these. I love that they stretch to fit any size baby and any size diaper! I love that they are soft. I love that they don't mess with my son's sensitive buns. I love that they are affordable. And most of all I love that they keep me from spraying poop off of cloth diapers because this mama has NO TIME for that mess. Literally. Stop researching other brands! Just buy these!
customer_reviews.author: THiers26

customer_reviews.title: Cloth diaper upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Best things ever. These save us from trying to scrape dried poop off the cloth diapers after daycare. They are better for the environment than disposable diapers. They are also so easy to use and pre put together for us and daycare. I basically think everyone should have them.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Roan

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Seem to resemble a fabric softner sheet without the fabric softner. They protect the diaper enough to satisfy my husband who is a stay at home dad who is not very excited about my choice to use cloth diapers. Our baby is only 2 months old though so she doesn't really have any solid waste diapers yet so they are still a bit messy. Mostly I think these are useful by allowing you to use diaper cream. It's apparently bad to use diaper cream with cloth diapers so these protect the diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L. Sison

customer_reviews.title: Great Accessory for Cloth Diapering
customer_reviews.text: Once my son started solids, I wanted a little help to deal with what comes next, and Bumpkins did the trick. They make cleaning up dirty diapers a breeze. All the solid poop is collected and can easily be tossed. It makes cleaning cloth diapers 100 percent easier, and I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MIA Mom

customer_reviews.title: Rips easily
customer_reviews.text: I was told to get these for my youngest's cloth diapers when we run low on disposables and need cloth, so I did. These rip very easily, whether wet or soiled. I will probably buy a different brand as I don't want a constant mess from it being so flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Cloth Diapering Must Have
customer_reviews.text: 4th time purchasing and will continue. Highly recommend for cloth diapering. Especially, once solids are started or toddler years. You just line the diaper and instead of spraying off the diaper you remove the sheet and trash or flush. Then diaper goes into wet bag or pale until washing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the softness and stretchy nature of the liner
customer_reviews.text: I like the softness and stretchy nature of the liner, but it really bunches up with little kiddo movers. When this happens, then it doesnt catch most of the solid waste very well leaving me scraping with wipes into the toliet. I havent had any issues with flushing these liners, or any allergic reactions. They can only be used once we diaper change because they nearly dissolve if you have a heavy wetter. I bought this once to compare the difference with other brands, and since my kid doesnt have a very sensitive tush, Im not going to purchase these again and instead go with the competitor's liners.
customer_reviews.author: Roxygidget

customer_reviews.title: It took us awhile to figure out these are probably ...
customer_reviews.text: It took us awhile to figure out these are probably not to be used with infant breastfed poop. The runny poop will just go through it. This is probably supposed to be used with thicker poops so that it can actually stay on one side and be lifted away by the liner. One problem that we had, regardless of poop, is that the liner would get bunched up and it's possible thicker poops will miss the liner and poop directly onto the cloth diaper, defeating the purpose of having a liner. All babies are different, but these liners probably will not work for us. We'll try again when her poops are more solid and we go back on cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Novel Living

customer_reviews.title: A trusty go-to
customer_reviews.text: These are great for CD parents. I cut a stack of these in half, so each box actually yields 200 liners for me. I use these in Charlie Banana cloth diapers and have no trouble dumping them in the toilet for a #2 diaper. If the diaper is just wet, I put the liner in the trash to cut down on how many are flushed.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas B. Whitstone

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed in these liners
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in these liners. We started using cloth diapers with our second child and I thought these would be great to help in the transition from disposables. Unfortunately, these liners are very thin and do not do a great job of holding in all his poop. I am not talking about when he has a blow out - I do not expect any liner to protect against that. But even his regular bowel movements sometimes leaked. To be perfectly honest, I found using his Huggies wipes (dried for a day, of course) protected him must better, was easier to clean up and was much, much less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE!!! TERRIBLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are AWFUL. I usually use Buttons liners, and bought these because Amazon was out. These are thin and stick to my daughter's butt. They feel scratchy and we have to wipe he bottom too hard just to get the poop off. They are an awkward, too-large size, too. You have to make sure you fold them just so and tuck in the edges. Good luck with that if you have a wiggly pretoddler. My daughters daycare hates these, too. DO NOT PURCHASE. Try the Buttons bamboo liners... they're at the same price point, but MUCH better quality (ie: thicker, softer, and sized perfectly for one-sided cloth diapers like BumGenius or Happy endings Night Nights).
customer_reviews.author: Serena Goodpasture

customer_reviews.title: Not super convenient, so I haven't used them all
customer_reviews.text: Not super convenient, so I haven't used them all. Good for nap time or when you're out and about if you always use cloth diapers though. Not worth using at bed time IMO. We just used disposables at night instead of fussing with these liners
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Wheelan

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing product
customer_reviews.text: We used cloth diapers exclusively through our kids first few years. One of these at night along with a cloth diaper insert made mornings a breeze. We simply couldn't function without having these on hand. I can't fathom how much money I saved going this route vs traditional diapers, but I'm sure it was at least well over a thousand. Thank you so much to the manufacturers for making this available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Please do not flush these. Also the fit is not as good as the rolled up brand. These are considerably more cost per sheet then the rolled up ones too. They don't go on as well because of the creases
customer_reviews.author: Lara T

customer_reviews.title: Not worth price, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: These were an okay price, but the quality is very disappointing. They are very thin and leak through. This was my first time buying them. I will not buy again. My friend bought g diaper liners and they are the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: A. Levesque

customer_reviews.title: Essential to Cloth Diapering
customer_reviews.text: I would probably give up on cloth diapering if it weren't for the existence of flushable liners. By keeping just a little bit of extra distance between me and poop, and my cute, expensive cloth diapers and poop, they make the whole cloth diapering experience so much easier. I've tried a lot of the flushable liners currently on the market, and these are my favorite thus far, for the following reasons: ✔ They hold up well under the insufferable weight of poop ✔ They flush easily ✔ They are cheaper than a lot of the other varieties out there Great product for cloth diapering parents!
customer_reviews.author: BT Invictus

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: These are great when you remember to use them. I've forgotten a couple of times and swirl/flush is not the most pleasant thing in the world. But man, using one of these and just tossing/flushing makes clean up so much easier! They also help keep the diaper clean so it's less likely to stain, and get funky in the bag until laundry day. These are a great option for those who aren't interested in spraying diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Higginbotham

customer_reviews.title: Bunched up in Diaper
customer_reviews.text: I did not like these liners. They did not stay in place, they would bunch up in the diaper and not collect the solid waste as I had hoped. The material is also thicker than other brands so they keep moisture closer to the skin than I liked.
customer_reviews.author: CPeters

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad
customer_reviews.text: These aren't my favorite liners of those I've tried, but they aren't bad. My baby girl has chunkier thighs & is very active. These liners are very thin. They are not to thing to hold the stool, but we have had trouble with them not catching the stool because they turned into a baby thong. We have had better luck with sturdier variations that don't shift around in the diaper so easily. We did not experience any trouble with clogging of our stool when flushing these, which is great. Honestly though, I haven't had that trouble with other brands either. If your baby has skinnier legs, this may work fine for you. The price point is awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Save time and reduce mess with prefolds
customer_reviews.text: We use these diaper liners in our daughter's reusable cloth diapers, and they have been reliable and function as expected. Thankfully, her bowel movements tend to happen at similar times of the day so we don't always use them however we have not noticed any skin irritation when we do. They hold up together well when wet, and are easy to transport to the toilet for flushing. They have saved a lot of scrubbing of our prefolds!
customer_reviews.author: G. Sindberg

customer_reviews.title: they are a good size and easy to fold to correctly fit a ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to help catch the #2 on my cloth diapers, they are a good size and easy to fold to correctly fit a variety of different sized diapers. They are very soft for baby's bottom and made it very easy to just drop the solids off from the diaper into the toilet. But then after 4 months of daily use...they clogged my toilet and I spent $100 on a plumber to come unclog our pipes as he pulled oodles of liners from our pipes. BE CAREFUL with the liners!! Plumber said nothing should ever be flushed down the toilet even if they are labeled "flushable." Back to swishing and a sprayer for me...
customer_reviews.author: Sadist112

customer_reviews.title: We cut them in half so they fit better into the diapers
customer_reviews.text: We use cloth diapers primarily and these liners make a big difference. My son is only now starting on solid foods, so I would expect these liners to be even more helpful in containing more solid messes in the months to come. We cut them in half so they fit better into the diapers, and one box lasted us almost 2 months with a newborn. My son is 6 months old, and I am only on my third box of these so they go a long way. I only occasionally flush them but have had no issues with them blocking up the toilet either.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These things make life SO MUCH EASIER when cloth diapering! We started using these after introducing solids, and they have made diaper cleaning much quicker and easier. They are a happy middle ground between complete cloth diapering and any kind of disposables.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect liner
customer_reviews.text: After trying 3 different kinds I can honestly say, these are hands down the single best liner. They are very soft, thick enough to not let #2 seep threw, I haven’t had them “shed” fibers on my baby which was an issue with the others, and they haven’t affected the diapers absorption at all! Will deffinately be buying these on a regular basis!
customer_reviews.author: Jade Newhouse

customer_reviews.title: Great for cloth diaper users
customer_reviews.text: If you are using cloth diapers - as my daughter is doing with her son - then you need to invest in these diaper liners. These will cut down on the about of feces you have to deal with. If you are on a public water system, then these are flushable. If you are on a septic system, you might want to think about it even though the product says it can be flushed into the septic system and will disintegrate. If you are using an "outhouse" system, then these will be fine and will disintegrate over time. These help reduce the about of fecal stain and improve washing/cleaning of cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Rose

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the bottom and the pocket book...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent diaper liners for cloth diapers. My kid dumps loads and this always makes it easy to pop out and dump in the toilet. Comes in easy dispensing box that works similar (but better than) a tissue box. This has been an indispensable addition to cloth diapering once our daughter started going to daycare. 10/10 would but 11/10 times.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K

customer_reviews.title: Soft and Overall great!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy these. I've tried several different brands and these are my go-to every time. They're soft and formidable. they fit well to baby and the diaper, are easy to tuck the sides in so you don't have any hanging outside of the diaper and contain the mess well. So far I haven't had any issues with my toilet clogging either so that's a major plus as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great for bedridden patients
customer_reviews.text: These biodegradable cloths are perfect for cleaning my husband who is bedridden. I can use them to clean him up or as toilet paper in a 911.
customer_reviews.author: JoeAnn

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: These are not as nice as other liners I have used, but they were significantly less expensive. I will probably buy again because they do the job, they just aren't as soft. I also have to fold these over to get them to fit in my diapers. I like the package they come in. It looks like a tissue box and the liners dispense easily from it. The product description says you need 4-6 boxes a month, but I think that's outrageous! I think one box a month is plenty and I'm exclusively cloth diapering.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: saving my diapers!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these things! They stay in place and completely catch to poop. Nothing goes through the liners and my son's diapers are just as white as they were when I bought them. It really saves a lot of time and cleaning effort. Coupled with flushable wipes the clean up that comes with reusable diapers is SO much easier and cleaner than I ever expected. Honestly, anything that lets me skip the spraying and scrubbing poop out of diapers is my best friend. love them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Sized Well
customer_reviews.text: The good: these are generously sized compared to Bummis. We used Bummis for a few months. As my daughter grew (and her "output") we ended up using two. Then I compared liners and sizes, and found these. Now we only use one and it contains everything my daughter puts out. The only down side to these (and the four star rating) is the container. It is a pain to have to pull them out. Once when my daughter was younger she pulled the liners ALL out of the box. I recommend keeping these out of reach. I spent over a half hour folding and putting them back in the box.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brooklynite

customer_reviews.title: we mainly use these to protect the diaper from diaper cream
customer_reviews.text: These are our go-to diaper liners, which we mainly use to protect our cloth diapers from our triple paste rash cream. I must say that these liners have never failed at protecting our diapers in 15 months of use. They have had the added bonus of making baby poo much easier to remove from the diaper as well. These have never caused plumbing problems for us, but we do flush them as little as possible
customer_reviews.author: Margaret W

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by how thin they are - they work!
customer_reviews.text: I stopped my search for the best liner because these are pretty kick arse. Don't be fooled by the thinness, they do their job well. Extremely soft and large to cover enough space. I rarely have overage on #2s. Flushable for my old plumbing and no issues. My husband even loves them! In comparison, G diaper liners are rough and you can't stretch them out. They do work but I had to put 2 side by side, expecially in the newborn stage, because it was hitting the diaper. Much more to hand wash than the Bumkins. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Queen fLee

customer_reviews.title: Practical and durable
customer_reviews.text: I use it on top of inserts. It keeps grainy particles out of inserts or covers (depending on how you use it). You can also use them as wipes, just apply warm water.
customer_reviews.author: Juliana and Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Good liners
customer_reviews.text: I like these liners. They are thin so they don't add extra bulk to already bulky cloth diapers. I don't think they work that well with breastfed babies since their poop is yellow and runny. My little one had a bm and the liner didn't seem to catch anything. All that poo just seeped through the liner into the diaper. I do see the potential in these liners with an older baby however. I also like the dispenser. The liners dispense like tissues so grabbing one is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: These are meh.
customer_reviews.text: These are okay, but definitely not my favorite liners. What I liked about them: They didn't clog the toilet, are priced very good, and didn't cause any rashes. What I didn't like about them: They were too large and difficult to fit inside a diaper, stretched and tore very easily, and had a tendency to get bunched up. Over all, they aren't terrible for the price, but I will be going back to usinginstead.
customer_reviews.author: Macy

customer_reviews.title: super soft and absorbent
customer_reviews.text: after using one box of these, i switched to kushies liners bcs they were on sale at a local store. i have just ordered three more boxes of these as they are FAR better. these are VERY soft and fit in the diaper very well. the only thing i dislike is how they are packaged; when i pul one out of the box a few come out at a time so i have to be prepared before i get baby undressed by pulling them apart. it's a small issue, though, considering how soft they are. my friend also bought the kushies liners and they gave her baby a rash. i would def recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: cerj

customer_reviews.title: Work great!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these for my cloth diapers!! They work great so I don't have to use a sprayer. They never rip or anything like that. Super durable.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Aeschliman

customer_reviews.title: No spraying needed with these liners!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased twice since starting solids with our baby and we love these. I don't have to spray diapers at all with using these. I open one up all the way and then fold it in half long was and it does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Jhead

customer_reviews.title: love the box
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I purchased this was that a majority of the liners came on a roll and are not very convenient for pulling it off mid diaper change. The pop out of the box like a kleenex so they are easier to pull and grab and insert if you are not the type to line your diapers before folding them under your changing table. they are soft and I had no problems with them irritating our daughter. They are fairly wide so I did have to tuck them into her diaper once everything was said and done because they seem fairly large but when she gets bigger I may appreciated that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy baby bottom
customer_reviews.text: I love these things, they are soft unlike some the GroVia. If your baby isn't making solid poops yet all this it will do is soak up some of the poop. I'd recommend waiting to use diaper liners until semi solid stool is made; otherwise you'll go through them way too quickly. I made this mistake.
customer_reviews.author: APRIL MARASCHIELLO-GATEWOOD

customer_reviews.title: Great cloth diaper investment
customer_reviews.text: These are great for on the go. At home I have a hose but on the go that’s not an option. I just throw out the solids and go about changing baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Cudworth

customer_reviews.title: Made cloth diapering harder
customer_reviews.text: I bought these liners based on good reviews but these just did not work for me at all. They dissolved fairly quickly and clumped on my little man's boy parts! Leaving felt bits everywhere When he did poop on them they bunched in enough at the thighs that I still had to spray out my shells. I won't be buying again and don't know what to do with the remaining 92 liners. I've decided that dunking and swishing homemade fleece liners is easier and feels cleaner than this product.
customer_reviews.author: Candace K

customer_reviews.title: They'll Save Your Cloth Diapering!
customer_reviews.text: I was about to quit cloth diapers. I had tried other liners, a diaper sprayer, swirling poopie diapers in the toilet. I really didn't want to go back to disposables however. A friend recommended I try Bumkins liners instead. They are fantastic. Long and wide enough, they also slightly adhere to the cloth diaper, not sticky exactly but they usually stay in place. Makes it very easy to then just dump poopie and liner into the toilet to be flushed. You might still get a little poop on the diaper now and then, but over all, this makes it a lot easier to deal with!
customer_reviews.author: impaz0330

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost at all.
customer_reviews.text: I cloth diaper. These help cut down the amout of poop but still leak breasmilk poops anways.. because it basically turns into a wet rag/poop rag in the diaper if your baby moves at all. It then gets wedged in the babys bumcrack leaking all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: UserSs

customer_reviews.title: a pain to work with
customer_reviews.text: These function as poop-catchers just fine, but they are definitely my least favorite liners that I have used. They are very soft, which seems nice for baby's bum, until you realize that you need 2 hands to get one out of the box, unfold it carefully, and lay it onto the diaper so it doesn't fold up/bunch up again. Doesn't work with a wiggly baby, who by then has fallen off the changing table and crawled away!! Also, you can't use them again if baby doesn't poop, because they get stretched out by...ehem...the boy parts. Might not be an issue for a girl.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: As flushable as a linen washcloth
customer_reviews.text: These work well for getting poop off the cloths after a day of sitting in the bag. But how they call these flushable I don't know. We have city sewer and have clogged up two different toilets in 6 months of using these. And we have the old school 2.5 gallon flush tanks. I couldn't imagine what they would do to a low flow toilet or a septic tank. I'll give them 5 stars for daiper liner duty and 1 star for being flushable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben J

customer_reviews.title: Go to for number two
customer_reviews.text: Having tried other disposable liners, we have found our go to! Very competitively priced, and well worth the money considering what they do, so that you don't have to! They are big enough to cover the whole of the diaper liner, and then easy enough to pull off and flush. This is the diaper liner you have been looking for! I noticed a comment about clogging the toilets. I must say I have two of the most clog prone toilets known to man in my home, but they have never clogged due to these liners, and we have used them for about to three years with our girls.
customer_reviews.author: Sizzle B

customer_reviews.title: ... bottom when it got soiled and gave her a terrible diaper rash because we had to peel it off
customer_reviews.text: This stuck to my daughter's bottom when it got soiled and gave her a terrible diaper rash because we had to peel it off, so it made her skin raw. We have almost an entire box left.
customer_reviews.author: A. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love using these liners. They save your cloth diapers from stains without compromising the absorbency. I just pull it out and either put it in the diaper pail or in the toilet. I have had no issues with clogs in the toilet from them, or a problem with our septic. They are soft so they are comfortable against baby's skin. They will move a little as your baby is getting into moving but still do their job!
customer_reviews.author: ATD

customer_reviews.title: Odd Size
customer_reviews.text: The size of these are odd and don't fit cloth diapers very well. They are wide and short so I have to fold 2 of them in half in order to fit 3/4 of the length of a cloth diaper. They are also not as soft as the Charlie Banana ones (and no I'm not being paid to say this). I bought these because the Charlie Banana ones were out of stock. I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Reindeer21

customer_reviews.title: Wasnt right for us
customer_reviews.text: We used these twice and don't like them. They stick to her parts and it's actually worse than just dealing with a dirty cloth diaper. They are way too big as well so we had to fold them but even with folding it stuck out of her diaper. We currently have a lot left, now I have to figure out what to do with them.
customer_reviews.author: Brittani

customer_reviews.title: Poop be gone
customer_reviews.text: They are a little to wide for my diapers but they do the job and I have no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Great cloth diaper liners.
customer_reviews.text: These are our favorite liners for our cloth diapers. However I think the ordering should be less confusing because the math is all wonky if you want to order more than one box. I always have to select one box and then just change the quantity. Hope they either fix the math or just take away that drop down menu.
customer_reviews.author: Dominion

customer_reviews.title: Best Bottom or prefolds
customer_reviews.text: This will be the third time I am purchasing this. This liner is soft, big and stretchy so you can wrap it around which ever insert you are using. Since it is soft it will stay put when you wrap it around Flip insert, Best Bottom or prefolds. I don't know how it would work on other brands of insert. It makes dumping solid waste so much easier. I don't use a water spray just this liner. No adverse reaction from my baby's bum either.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hwong

customer_reviews.title: These fall apart as soon as they get wet.
customer_reviews.text: Diaper was not on baby for a full 2 hours and this fell apart. It made even more of a mess then when not using it. I had to pull pieces off babies bottom. Very disappointed after reading all the good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea B.

customer_reviews.title: They do their job, with some tweaks.
customer_reviews.text: These liners do their job, but they are a bit of a pain. They tend to bunch up with wear, so I have to strategically place them my little one's diaper. I also have to fold them since they are HUGE, which is kind of tedious while changing a squirmy baby. I honestly prefer my cut up micro-fleece blanket liners, but I do keep some of these on hand for outings.
customer_reviews.author: j4j16

customer_reviews.title: These are really good  disposable diaper liners !!
customer_reviews.text: I love these disposable liners !! They fit so well with my diaper routine and it's so easy to clean and protects my diapers from a mess!! They don't bunch up either. I just simply wrap it around my insert and lay it in the diaper and it holds up well!! Great for helping with poopy messes!! I will definitely be buying more!!
customer_reviews.author: Milhu

customer_reviews.title: Completely worthless - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as an alternative to the Charlie Banana liners we use, thinking to save some money. The box says "100 count" but it may as well be "10 count." What they consider a single liner is literally tissue paper thin. In the end you have to use so many that the final cost per change is basically $1 - far MORE expensive than the overpriced Charlie Banana counterpart.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A. Fox

customer_reviews.title: They’re good but don’t think they are worth it
customer_reviews.text: I thought I’d use these to make clean up easier but I probably used like 5. I’d totally just skip liners and clean the diaper itself
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These liners feel like dryer sheets
customer_reviews.text: Works well. They do tend to shift a little bit in the diaper, but I think this is baby movement issue not a liner quality issue. These liners feel like dryer sheets. I love Grovia diapers, but prefer these liners over their liners because of the feeling and how these stay folder over. I usually unfold them then fold them in half or so length wise as they are a bit too wide. They mostly always keep the mess off the diaper making it easier to remove. Unless I forget to put a liner in the diaper I rarely have to rinse/scrape anything off the diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Tara S.

customer_reviews.title: Love these liners!
customer_reviews.text: I was new to cloth diapering and was most worried about the 'poopy diaper' scare. These liners solved my problems in an instant! Pros: -They don't bunch up -Contain poop well and do not soil the insert or the diaper -Flushable as advertised -Length is quite good, in fact you could cut it into half and use twice the amount Cons: NONE
customer_reviews.author: Fun_pry

customer_reviews.title: Great product - just hard to get out of the package
customer_reviews.text: These are difficult to get out of the package, and when you are dealing with a wiggly baby who doesn't want to stay in his changing table, that "extra measure" to get the liners out of the package is just a little too much. I went with the roll the next time around and was much happier. Other than that, its a great product. Serves its purpose well and covers the WHOLE diaper, which is nice for those blowouts! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: aclaw

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these twice, so I suppose I like them more than "okay". But I don't expect much from them, either. I use them to line DS' inserts when I think he's probably going to be pooping; they hold up better over some inserts over others, or maybe it depends on his movements. SOmetimes they bunch, sometimes they don't. I don't try to wash them if he just peed through it. But I have found that remove a good chunk (! ha !) of the mess regardless of if they bunched up when he wore them while pooping.
customer_reviews.author: AmericanDoll

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cloth diaper protection
customer_reviews.text: These work great protecting my cloth diapers. Keeps the poop off if he goes and blocks all oil from diaper rash oil from reaching the diaper. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Rip or cut in half to save money! Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These make poopy diaper changes a breeze! The couple of times I’ve forgotten them in a pee only diaper they broke down quite a bit in the wash, so I’m not worried about them clogging our pipes. I do rip them in half because half of one nearly covers the entire inside of the diaper!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle v

customer_reviews.title: Best disposable liner
customer_reviews.text: These are the absolute best disposable liner we've tried. They are strong enough and big enough to contain everything 99% of the time. The other 1% is it coming up the back of the cloth diaper so it's unavoidable. Never flushed them though, just threw them in the garbage. Thin enough to not make the cloth liners bulkier.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Pretty worthless
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I'm just anti-liners, but I couldn't figure out why these were so great. They don't stay put, and poo gets all over not matter what. I bought them to put in dipe whenever we were out, but they didn't work out. My alternative is to use a diaper cover, like Thirsties, and put a disposable insert from a G-diaper inside. That way, you just throw away the entire diaper, and the cover can be easily wiped out. The only use I find for these is to wipe babe's bottom after he uses potty. But, that's an expensive altenative to, you know, toilet paper.
customer_reviews.author: kackerman

customer_reviews.title: SO useful!
customer_reviews.text: SO so so useful when cloth diapering. Once the poops got more, um, substantial - these became a lifesaver so that we didn't have piles and piles of poopy cloth diapers awaiting laundering every day. We could remove the mess without having to dig into the mess every three hours with our hands. Saved us time, still very small amount of waste produced, safely flushable. LOVE. Made it possible for us to keep cloth diapering as our baby grows.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha W.

customer_reviews.title: You can use them as wipes too!
customer_reviews.text: I was told by my diapering service to use liners with staining diaper creams. So this did the job. I found another good use for these liners. When my son had diaper rash, I would use these as less harsh wipes, just dipping them in water. Surprisingly they worked great, and I used them more often as wipes than as diaper liners.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper liner to make life easier.
customer_reviews.text: Ever since introducing solids to my cloth diapered daughter, I have started using these rather than purchasing a diaper sprayer. I just add a liner to each diaper as I stuff my diapers. They really make a difference when it comes to poopy diaper clean up. What a breeze! I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Monica L.

customer_reviews.title: Soft but Imse Vimse works better
customer_reviews.text: I originally thought I would like these cloth diaper liners better, and I think they were more comfortable for my baby....BUT I ended up liking the Imse Vimse Flushable Liners better because the worked better. They didn't move around as much in the diaper and they were strong enough to actually run through the wash once or twice and use again. So if you are debating, I'd go with Imse Vimse.
customer_reviews.author: Junebug87

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: These work well as a cover for liners which is how I use them. When I’ve used them on their own (without cloth liners), they get bunched up which doesn’t really work.
customer_reviews.author: JBMTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: awkward shape
customer_reviews.text: These do not work well with charlie banana diapers. These liners are square shaped and the fit is very awkward. I will stick to buying charlie banana liners from now on.
customer_reviews.author: ELW

customer_reviews.title: BEST FOR BOYS!
customer_reviews.text: We tried several different liners for our son and found these were the best! They are strong enough that they don't tear, but also soft enough that they don't irritate by son. Other products resulted in bad irritation. I will not use anything else but the Bumkins liners.
customer_reviews.author: Callie

customer_reviews.title: Cloth diapering is so easy and painless now. :)
customer_reviews.text: These diaper liners are great. They catch almost all the waste. We figured out our daughter's schedule so we don't have to use one with every diaper. We use 2 liners a day. The only negative thing I can say is sometimes they get bunched up, but I leave two of the corners hang out of her diaper and it holds it in place. :) Buy these if you cloth diaper or plan on cloth diapering. They are the perfect size for our 18 month old (and have been using them for about 4 months now)
customer_reviews.author: D. Lingle

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to use and priced well.
customer_reviews.text: We were having a lot of trouble with our cloth diapers getting clean due to the solid waste and our dislike of spraying and dunking. These are a life saver! They work so well, keeping the solid waste from sticking, that the first time I changed his diaper I wasn't expecting it - and the solid waste just rolled off onto the floor when I tipped the diaper without thought. Gross, but quite amazing in regards to easy diaper clean up :D Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

product_meta.title: Bumkins Flushable Biodegradable Cloth Diaper Liner, Neutral, 100 Count, (Pack of 1)
product_meta.description:
Size:1 PackBiodegradable and flushable*, Bumkins soft Flushable Diaper Liners are the easiest clean-up solution for soiled diapers. Compatible with any cloth diapering system, these liners provide added convenience and stain protection to any cloth diapering routine.
How to use: Simply place liner on the inside of a clean diaper before placing the diaper on the baby. During diaper changes, lift the liner containing the waste out of the diaper and dispose of it in the toilet* or trash receptacle. *Not recommended for septic tanks. Know your toilet!"

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
New from Bumkins. Simply place liner on diaper and when soiled, just flush liner down the toilet. Not recommended for septic systems. Know your toilet.
feature_bullets: Provides added convenience and stain protection to any cloth diapering routine. The easiest clean-up solution for soiled diapers.
Biodegradable and flushable. Not recommended for septic tanks.
Compatible with any cloth diapering system
Average user will go through 4 to 6 of the 100ct packs per month
Made of 100% bamboo viscose that's breathable, yet absorbs moisture

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,531 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
